itemListElement.name: Supernatural History of the Pacific Northwest Pub Crawl

name: Supernatural History of the Pacific Northwest Pub Crawl
description:
Let us take you on an adventure through some of the most iconic pubs in the pike place market area, and entertain you with the grand mysteries of the Pacific Northwest. Whether or not you are a believer this tour will give you an entertaining and engaging experience filled with great stories and firsthand paranormal experiences!

We are Paranormal and supernatural enthusiasts that love to explore the profound mysteries of the Pacific Northwest! Unlike other ghost tours, our tour gives you an overview of all of the paranormal happenings and creatures of the PNW. From the more recent to the ancient, we will be exploring these phenomenon with entertaining and engaging dialogue.

If you love mysteries, conspiracies and the occult, this tour is for you! Your souls will be shaken!

itemListElement.name: Street Savvy FREE Walking Tours Seattle

name: Street Savvy FREE Walking Tours Seattle

address.streetAddress: 5th Ave S And S King Street Intersection

name: Teatro ZinZanni: Hollywood & Vine
description: Enjoy a unique evening of cabaret, comedy and a full-course dinner at the famous Teatro ZinZanni situated in the heart of wine country in  Woodinville, WA. Set in a turn-of-the-century tent, Teatro ZinZanni is a big night out unlike any other and is much more than just dinner, it's a 3-hour whirlwind of cirque, comedy and cabaret all served up with a delicious 4-course meal. Described as "the Kit Kat club on acid," and "the place where the Moulin Rouge meets Cirque du Soleil," Teatro ZinZanni is an experience not to be missed while visiting Seattle.

review.name: Zinzanni
review.reviewBody:
Show was good and entertaining but please loose the Maestro.
He is kreepy and does not bring anything to the play
Tamara.

review.name: Lots of Fun and Great Food
review.reviewBody: We had ring-side seats and saw everything (including some of the cheesy "magic" tricks. For the most part, great night. If you arrive before the show, their boutique offers items you can wear for the show, but they aren't necessary. The ostrich boas were $38 - yikes. Some audience members did dress like they were attending a cabaret but for the most part, everyone wore nicer clothing. If you can find boas, hats, etc before the show, cheaper to wear them there than buy anything. Everything seems pricey. Also, not a venue for shorts. The A/C was a bit cool at times, but I had a light sweater and was fine. Before the show, we bought 2 glasses of Paco & Lola Albarino wine at $14 each. Plus tax and tip (not sure why this was necessary; she stood right there and poured the wine.) The total was $35.42.   Tip for the waiter $60, plus drinks so bring extra cash. I would return as the show changes every 6 weeks.

review.name: A great time
review.reviewBody: This was our first time at the new venue in Woodinville.  We went to the show in Seattle more than 10 years ago.  We really enjoyed the new location because we live nearby and the parking was easy.  The show was a riot of entertainment.  For us the singing by Kelly Britt and Amelia Zirin-Brown really stood out.  The gymnasts and acrobats were fantastic too.  We really like the intimacy of this show with dinner served all throughout.  The food was very good - I had the yellow fin tuna and my wife had the steak.  The spiegeltent just feels more comfortable than something so big as Cirque du Soleil.

review.name: Superb Show and lovely dinner
review.reviewBody: Wow, I was blow away by the show. It was put together nicely and had a bit of everything. It had performances, magic, comedy, dancing and even a bit of audience participation. I was very impressed with the entire night and would highly recommend it. The food was great and the wine list was perfect. This is a well put together show and will not let you know. I was very impressed by the theater.

review.name: Disappointing birthday gift
review.reviewBody:
I bought two tickets for my sister and her husband as  a birthday gift. I was so disappointed to hear from them how their evening was. The temperature in the tent was so high it was uncomfortable and led to her being ill. The food she called ho hum and the show was just nice. Not anywhere near the quality that I had been lead to believe this show was. 
Very disappointed and will not be attending myself or giving as gifts again.

itemListElement.name: Seattle Space Needle Observation Deck Admission Ticket

name: Seattle Space Needle Observation Deck Admission Ticket
description: Travel to the top of the Space Needle's 520 ft. observation deck for unparalleled views of downtown Seattle, Mt. Rainier, and the Puget Sound. Seattle’s “must see” is now a “must do” following the Space Needle’s multi-million dollar renovation. Glide onto The Loupe, the world’s first and only rotating glass floor, for never-before-seen views of the structure and the city.  Lean into our Skyrisers, the tilting glass walls on the open-air deck, and float over Seattle on one of the 24 angled vantage points. Sip and sample the Pacific Northwest’s best while savoring the thrilling views.

review.name: Go around sunset!
review.reviewBody: If you can time your experience, get there at least an hour before they close and experience the sunset.  It is pretty cool to experience, even thought it was a little pricey for what it is.  Food and drink at the top are expensive, so be sure to calculate that in your trip.

review.name: Breathtaking!
review.reviewBody: The Space Needle is fantastic.  The Observation Deck allows visitors the opportunity to take as much time as desired to enjoy the visit.  The view is breathtaking.

review.name: It’s good
review.reviewBody: I went during the night. The view was nice and I thought that it was a cool experience. The revolving glass floor was my favorite part.

review.name: It's the Space Needle!
review.reviewBody: How can you not visit the Space Needle when visiting Seattle? You can walk from the main downtown area and it's a great area to see. Views from the top are amazing! Yes, it's a bit pricey and not something you do many times, but if you've never been to the top, do it!

review.name: ICONIC AND UPDATED
review.reviewBody: 3RD TIME AROUNG FOR US.  THE EXTERNAL UPGRADE WITH PLEXI GLASS IS A PLUS.  IT ADDS TO THE EXPERIENCE.  ONCE YOU WALK AROUND THE ENTIRE PERIMETER... JUST CHILL IN THE LOUNGE AND HAVE A CUP OF COFFEE AND TAKE IT ALL IN.  DONT RUSH.  TAKE YOUR TIME AND TAKE LOTSA PICS.  NOVEMBER TO FEBRUARY IS USUALLY NOT SO BUSY.   WEVE DONE THE JULY TRIP AND THAT WAS CHALLENGING

review.name: Take photos from glass-bottomed level
review.reviewBody: My adult daughter and I visited on a sunny July day. The whole process of entering and moving through the Needle went smoothly, a good operation. We liked the glass-bottomed level that provided better photos than being outside on the observation deck! While it was enclosed, the glass was clean and did not have any sun reflections. Whereas the plastic shielding on the observation deck is not quite as clear.

review.name: Iconic must do
review.reviewBody: Iconic, must do. We were able to check in fifteen minutes prior to our ticket time. It was about a 30 minute wait in line, they take your picture (if you want), then elevator up to the observation deck. You can spend as much time up there as you you'd like.

review.name: Get on top of Seattle
review.reviewBody: I have travelled to Seattle for years, but first time in the Space Needle since I was 12. There have been so many changes to the skyline since. Really worth it! Stunning views!

review.name: Slight sticker shock, but honestly worth it.
review.reviewBody:
I didn't have this on my list of "must do"s while in Seattle. Ticket price depends on day and time, but it's roughly $45 to ride an elevator. 

That said, it really is spectacular. The elevator opens on the main observation deck, and yes, the views are absolutely magnificent, but I was also impressed with the facility itself. It's very clean and modern and makes the whole experience majestic. Outside, there's a little bit of an overhang overhead, but most of the deck is open to the sky. The incredibly thick windows slant outward and must be a nightmare to keep clean, but somehow the staff manage it. Most people crowd to the south side of the tower, facing the heart of the city and the skyscrapers, but the whole view is incredible. 

Downstairs is a 21+ lounge and glass floor that rotates. However, you don't need to visit the lounge to stand on the glass floor and watch the city go by around you. 

FYI, there is a small bar upstairs and the lounge downstairs, but they are on different liquor licenses, so they don't allow you to buy a drink and take it downstairs. 

The staff is great, everyone was so nice and friendly. And while the price seemed steep, there is no time limit except for closing time, so enjoy the view, the drinks, and the pies as long as you want (and as long as your wallet holds out). 

I didn't feel the need to do this, but I'm glad my friend wanted to and talked me into it. Do yourself a huge favor and go at sunset. Even with grey skys, it's pretty incredible.

review.name: Seattle von oben ansehen
review.reviewBody:
Schöner Ausblick auf die Stadt, gut bezahlt. Ist durchaus zu empfehlen, wenn man es versäumt, ist es aber auch nicht so tragisch, Seattle von oben ist jetzt nicht das unvergessliche Mega-Erlebnis …
Immerhin wird man fotografiert und kann sich dieses Erinnerungsfoto gratis zusenden lassen (Automaten sind auf der Aussichtsplattform). 
Wenn man unter der Woche früh kommt (8 Uhr) kann man problemlos gleich hinauffahren, sonst empfehle ich Vorreservierung im Internet.

Unbedingft empfehlenswert ist der Kauf der Kombi-Karte mit dem "Chihuly Garden and Glass". Das ist äußerst sehenswert!

name: Seattle Seaplane Tour
description: Experience unsurpassed aerial views of Seattle on this 20-minute seaplane tour. Explore the Emerald City, all the while taking in the panoramic Northwest vistas. The pilot will provide a personal narration and all the clients are issued noise-canceling aviation headsets. The sensational experience of taking off and landing on the water, combined with the amazing views of Seattle and Puget Sound, come together to create the memory of a lifetime.

name: 20-Minute Greater Seattle Scenic Airplane Tour
description: Take off on a scenic airplane tour of Seattle, and witness aerial views of the Emerald City and panoramic Northwest vistas. Your pilot will give a personal narration and all the clients are issued noise canceling aviation headsets.   You will be lead on a sensational flight with amazing views of Seattle and Puget Sound for the memory of a lifetime.

review.name: Seaplane scenics
review.reviewBody: My pilot was awesome , great experience since it was a first time, great view of the cities, i would recommend visiting them

review.name: amazing tour!
review.reviewBody: Our check in was super smooth and on-time, pilot was knowledgeable, and flight was not scary at all. We had great views with underlying notes made by pilot, and city looks so much more interesting from the air! I highly recommend this experience.

review.name: Adventure trip everyone should have this experience
review.reviewBody:
Awesome! We enjoyed alot
My pilot is so cool, he explained everything around and he also checked on us everytime

review.name: Awesome experience
review.reviewBody: Such a cool experience! I surprised my girlfriend with this trip for her birthday and she loved it. The pilot was a fun and funny guy with a lot of knowledge about the city. I’d recommend this experience to anyone who wants to learn more about Seattle from a great vantage point.

review.name: Seaplane tour of Seattle
review.reviewBody: This was absolutely the highlight of our visit to Seattle.   Had a great pilot/tourguide and we went around Seattle and saw the sights.    Words can't really describe how much fun this was.    It's a small plane, and it bounces around a bit in the wind, so I can't recommend it for people who are afraid of flying, but we had a great time and would highly recommend it to those who don't mind the bumps !

review.name: First-timer
review.reviewBody: Wayne was an excellent pilot and very personable! The experience was so smooth and he was very knowledgeable about the city. I would recommend this to anyone who is a first timer and wants to do something unique to learn about the city.

review.name: Birthday Bummer!
review.reviewBody: Really disappointed.  We arrived early.  There is nobody there to meet you.  You are just supposed to sit outside the gate, waiting for someone to show up.  They finally arrived (10) minutes late…. which isn’t that bad.   But then the pilot came up to us and said we wouldn’t be able to complete our tour.  Apparently we exceeded weight limit for (3) passengers.  Which is (500) lbs.  We were definitely above that.  However, we even reported our weight while booking.  We even emailed to find out the weight limit weeks ahead, and couldn’t get a straight answer.  It cost us $100 for Uber rides there and back.  They were at least very apologetic, and issued a full refund.  They offered to reschedule… but we were only in town for a weekend, and this was on my wife’s birthday.  Total waste of our time.

review.name: Soulless and inconsiderate small business.
review.reviewBody:
Do not get tricked by the official website’s ticket and package options. They are all arbitrary depending on the mood and the weather of the people who work there, including James (the man in charge).

If you are a couple please note that you may be put into a plane with other people regardless of what plane and option you picked. You will not know about it until you get to the meeting point and one couple will not get to sit together. Thus, it may be better to look into other companies and there are others!

If you are planning to go as a group, there are better and more professional establishments which are cheaper and/or same priced.

The only saving point of this establishment is Mark (seaplane pilot) who made all the efforts to not only ensure that our experience on the air was great but also to redeem the Company.

Overall, in the state where aviation is one of the major industries, there are better, more professional, and cost efficient companies and small businesses. Try them. They will have more respect and consideration for your experience. If you insist on booking from this establishment, exaggerate your weight to make sure that they cannot fly anyone with you.

review.name: Seattle Skyline from an aerial viwe
review.reviewBody: This was a great experience and I would do it again. The pilot was great and made us feel very comfortable.  I would recommend to anyone who would like to see Seattle from another view.

review.name: Awesome!!
review.reviewBody: The pilot was very friendly and professional and seemed very knowledgeable about the areas around Seattle. He shared pertinent information with me in regards to the aircraft and I would highly recommend.

itemListElement.name: Space Needle and Chihuly Garden and Glass Combination Ticket

name: Space Needle and Chihuly Garden and Glass Combination Ticket
description:
Seattle’s must-see architectural marvel is now a can’t-miss experience after the Space Needle's transformational renovation. Explore 2 new levels of thrills, plus views of sparkling waters and snow-capped mountains. Step out on The Loupe, the world’s first and only revolving glass floor, for never-before-seen views of the structure and city. Lean into tilting glass walls on the open-air outdoor observation deck. Float over Seattle on one of 24 Skyrisers, angled glass benches perched around the outdoor deck. 

Located next to the Space Needle, Chihuly Garden and Glass lets you immerse yourself in a world where curiosity, creativity and color come to life. Throughout the Galleries, ever-changing Garden and signature Glasshouse, you’ll be inspired by artist Dale Chihuly’s innovation and passion. All guests receive complimentary digital photo downloads and access to daily Gallery Talks and live glass demonstrations. Admission includes complimentary audio tour (smartphone required).

review.name: Weekend in Seattle
review.reviewBody: The space needle is a must to check off your list. The glass museum was a pleasure to visit. The awe of the size of the installations and amazing colors was breathtaking.

review.name: Chihuly glass is a MUST
review.reviewBody: Space needle was good, panoramic views were nice. However, Chihuly glass was AMAZING and made the combo ticket absolutely worth it! And, The Bar was great, super good food quality, awesome cocktail selection and service was solid. Highly recommend!

review.name: Wonderful experience
review.reviewBody: We had a wonderful time , The space needle was a different experience and the glass museum was beautiful and beautiful definitely worth the trip.

review.name: good 1/2 day activity
review.reviewBody: Must see for Seattle visitors. Great timeline history wall to read as you wait for your ride to the top.  Highly recommend going on a clear day to be able to see views.  Chihuly is a great experience. Beautiful works of art made from glass.

review.name: A must in Seattle
review.reviewBody: A great experience.   Entry was handled well.  A good idea to get there early.  We bought ticket at 9 am.  Chairs to sit and view.  Glass floor not as scary as I thought it might be.

review.name: Highly recommended
review.reviewBody: Amazing highly  recommend this was a a honeymoon trip and everything we did was so much fun in Seattle all the way to the mountains to the city

review.name: worth it to book and purchase in advance
review.reviewBody: this combination ticket seems to have been a real value. We had bought the combination ticket online ahead of time. We needed to book the time for our trip to the top of the Space Needle, so this was extremely helpful. We're really glad to have visited both sites.

review.name: Forget about it! Total scam!
review.reviewBody: Booked a slot at 5:35h . We were able to enter the line at 5:25h but after 30 minutes we only made it to the 4th picture frame of at least 12, so the wait time would have been more than 1.5h. We decided to leave and wie really don‘t understand why the sell slots when the are not able to manage their capacities. Nearly 100 Dollar lost for nothing.

review.name: MUST do in Seattle
review.reviewBody:
The Space Needle is a must do in Seattle! The views from the top are phenomenal. We were lucky enough to have a beautiful sunny day. All the snow capped mountains were just stunning. Mt. Rainier in all its glory was worth the 41 second trip to the top. If possible, be in the front of the elevator with camera ready for the ride up and down.

Chihuly Garden and Glass is amazing. The colors and design are so stunning. Take your time to enjoy each piece. I only wish there were more. So incredibly colorful.

review.name: Good experience.
review.reviewBody:
Amazing view and nice ideas with glass bottom in the needle. Elevator operator was very funny. Chihuly garden also impressive. All in all nice i can recommend it is a must see in Seattle. It’s a fast experience so you don’t 
 Need much time for this. Can be completed easily in 1,5 hrs if you are on a rush

itemListElement.name: Seattle City Tour with Space Needle Drop Offs

name: Seattle City Tour with Space Needle Drop Offs
description:
As a military veteran, we honor veterans with a discount thanks for your service. Seniors 62 and upward, get your discount as well. Now this tour is like binge watching three episodes of your favorite program, minus the zombies & dragons. I do have a troll, a Space Needle, waterfall, giant Amazon spheres and Pixar UP House just like the movie floating houses (Sleepless in Seattle) We will even show you where Boeing 1st airplane took flight. If you have never seen Jurasick Park Pterodactyls come March - July to see them, I ain’t lying. This tour is both structured & spontaneous, guaranteed to learn and laugh. 
Yes, you will see the famous sights, and unique neighborhoods as well.
Thank you Viator for awarding Seattle's Best Tours as a TOP 20 Experience in the USA in 2022 - 2023

review.name: Entertaining, informative, and fun!
review.reviewBody: Earl was amazing! We learned so much history about the city, got to see and understand the impact COVID had, and how the culture is developing! We even got to see a few places only locals would know about and got great recommendations for food! Will absolutely book with him again on another trip.

review.name: Amazing city tour
review.reviewBody: We had an almost one on one experience.  The tour went into great details of parts we would have never seen . Very informative and very personal.

review.name: City Tour
review.reviewBody: Earl was great! :) Very knowledgeable, entertaining, and friendly. I learned a lot about Seattle as an out-of-towner!

review.name: Here for a ball game…tour was a bonus!
review.reviewBody: This was a great way to see the highlights of the city while we were here for a Detroit Tigers/Seattle Mariners game.  Earl was very entertaining and informative.  I highly recommend this trip while visiting the Seattle area!

review.name: Great overview tour!
review.reviewBody: Fun city tour     The driver/guide was funny and entertaining!     Drove around to see many different neighborhoods in Seattle

review.name: Great tour for visitors and locals alike.
review.reviewBody: Scheduled this tour when we arrived in Seattle; Earl called the morning of to confirm and since we were the only customers on Sunday kindly picked us up right from our hotel. Earl had a great personality and answered every question we had (and more) about Seattle. He took us to several neighborhoods, we saw the Locks, and leaned the difference between a houseboat and a floating house. Earl and his tour was well worth the $$ we spent and would recommend this tour to one and all. We now know a lot more about Seattle than when we first got here.

review.name: Fantastic!
review.reviewBody: What an incredible way to see the city! Earl was fantastic and very personable. Shared many trivial facts about the city and sites. Navigating through the city is a feat in itself and Earl did it with ease all while making sure to stop at the most interesting and picturesque sites. Can’t recommend him enough. If you’re on the fence about it don’t be. Additionally, given the cost of Ubers and gas the price point is well worth it.

review.name: Don't miss this!!!!!
review.reviewBody:
If I could give this 10 stars,  I would!!  This tour with Earl was the highlight of our entire trip as he is enthusiastic about the city and makes you an instant friend. We learned so much and the hours flew by.  A very accommodating tour and the best part seriously was this was a fresh presentation-  Earl loves people and his job.
A +++++++

review.name: Amazing tour guide!
review.reviewBody:
Here for work on the off season and wanted to get an overview of Seattle. Earl let me know I was the only one who booked the tour and asked if I’d like to cancel or go solo (just for context solo millennial female traveler). I didn’t mind doing it by myself so solo it was! Earl was AMAZING! So nice and absolutely hilarious. I had a blast with him. Learned a lot that I can apply to my downtime during my work trip. Couldn’t recommend him more highly. 
I do a lot of solo tours while on work trips and Earl was by far the best I’ve had.

review.name: Fun , informative and entertaining
review.reviewBody: We would highly recommend Earl to be your guide to the neighborhoods and sights of Seattle. He is friendly, courteous, and entertaining. He bends over backward to make sure your tour is as good as it can be. The day of our scheduled tour was very rainy and overcast. He called us to offer rescheduling to the following day, forecasted to be sunny. We accepted his offer and , being the only customers that day, got the “presidential” treatment in his spacious SUV. He was very informative and entertained us with interesting stories about the past and current local events while we saw the sights of Seattle and surrounding areas. Earl is the best and you’ll have a great time!

itemListElement.name: Day and Night Space Needle Admission Ticket

name: Day and Night Space Needle Admission Ticket
description: Experience the beauty of Seattle from 520-feet in the air with this day and night admission pass good for two visits in a 24 hour period. Visit the famous Space Needle Observation Deck for unparalleled views of the surrounding city and mountains during the day, then return at night for gorgeous views of the city at night. Admission is valid for two visits during a 24 hour time span.

review.name: Two different elevator operators crammed people into the elevator for a very uncomfortable and dangerous ride
review.reviewBody: We went to the Space Needle on 5/26/23.  The view from the top was fantastic and well worth it.  Unfortunately, the behavior of the guys running the elevators overshadowed the experience in a bad way.  Two different elevator operators crammed people into the elevator for a very uncomfortable and dangerous ride.  He kept saying that there was plenty of room for more people just by looking at the floor and seeing all the space around our feet.  I guess he doesn't realize that people's feet take up a lot less physical space than the rest of our bodies do.  We actually had to all scream "NO!" when he was trying to cram 4 more people in the elevator.  He finally got the hint at that point, and even told us that he could've easily added 9 more people!  During one elevator ride, there were small children in the elevator that were crammed in with an extreme and overwhelming amount of adults to where the children were screaming and crying.  It was terrifying for them!  I understand you wanting to not have long lines waiting for the elevators, but the way these 2 elevator operators filled the elevators with people was absolutely ridiculous and they should be reprimanded!  I heard one elevator operator getting rewarded for emptying his waiting line quickly.  This is absolutely uncalled for and should not be tolerated going forward.  Management really needs to do something about it.

review.name: Not Worth a Visit Just to See Glass Floor
review.reviewBody: I had not visited the Space Needle since it was remodeled so I was really looking forward to this, especially the glass floor. I was, however, somewhat disappointed. The glass floor simply wasn't all that amazing. Yeah, it's nice you can look down at the ground, but the views looking out of the windows is better. If you are going just to see the glass floor, don't bother. One thing I really liked about the visit this time was that there was hardly anyone there. Due to covid, they are restricting the number of guests and it really makes a difference. Every other time I have visited the Space Needle it was so crowded that it didn't make for a very pleasant visit. It was also the first time I was there when it wasn't cloudy, which meant that the views were much nicer. Needless to say, the Space Needle is the must see attraction in Seattle, but if you're a local, it's not worth it to go up just to see the glass floor. They were very careful about taking precautions for covid. You had to go through an ultraviolet disinfector before getting into the elevator, no talking was allowed in the elevator at all and mask wearing was very strictly enforced at all times.

review.name: Improved experience since my last visit
review.reviewBody:
Okay, I was reluctant to pay the $30 to go up to the top again since the last time it was so cloudy and foggy I could not see a thing, but since it was clear this day and I had heard they made improvements, I went again.  It was worth it.  The newish glass floor is an amazing addition.  The day was clear and you could see all around.

Now I do feel the $30 admission is fairly steep and I wouldn't g o up again, but it is worth doing it once.

review.name: Beautiful views!
review.reviewBody:
We enjoyed our trip up in the space needle--the views from the top were just gorgeous, especially since it was a clear day!We were visiting Seattle for the first time, so a trip up in this iconic landmark was a must do!

I get a little motion sick, so I didn't love the revolving deck--I stepped on the glass floor briefly to see what it looked like below, but I didn't stay long because it very noticeably rotates. It was fun to sit back on the glass benches and lean back on the glass walls for photos. 

One thing that was pretty high-tech and cool was the free photos--like many places they take your photo on a green screen when you arrive. What's different than anywhere else I've ever been is that they give you the link to the website where you can put your code number in and choose your backgrounds and download them for free--you don't have to pay a thing! It wasn't one of those traps where they take a photo and you pay $30 for it.

review.name: Nothing Like It Was
review.reviewBody: They spent $100 million and ruined the Space Needle.  The iconic revolving restaurant is completely gone, replaced with some glass in the floor so you can look...down?  That's not where the view is.  Where the unobstructed view used to be, on the observation deck, there are now surrounding thick glass plates which reflect light, ruin photographs and are constantly smudged.  I lived in Seattle, went up the Needle three or four times a year, celebrated many occasions with a great meal in the restaurant and lingered over the great view from the top.  In this new and heartbreaking incarnation, it is nothing but a tourist trap.  I'm done.

review.name: Enjoyed the entire experience.
review.reviewBody: The space needle was fun. I even stepped on the glass on the revolving deck.  Felt very safe. They have some type of ultraviolet cleaning before you go up. It was very peaceful and the views were amazing!

review.name: Worth it
review.reviewBody:
I've been to the Space Needle twice and I was satisfied on both occasions. The lift is fun, the deck has a great view of the Downtown, Waterfront, Mt. Baker, Mt. Rainier and the base of the tower. When entering the Needle you get to see its history on a fun timeline and also have your group's pic taken.

A downside goes to the price (could be a bit lower) and how packed it gets.

I personally recommend going on a clear skies day as early as it opens. Don't forget to download the app so you can schedule a virtual bungee jump and also see the pics you take on your tour.

review.name: More than a tourist trap
review.reviewBody:
It's cliche as something can be, but you have to do the Space Needle. It's a great view tourist trap with a restaurant and a gift shop however it's also so much more. It's remnants of a Worlds Fair and what our future was supposed to look like.  I was hiding my silly excitement, I finally got to ride to the top after waiting  my whole life! My excuse was taking my children to see the view, but it was finally checked of my bucket list.

The lines on popular weekends can be long,  although not hugely expensive but it adds up in the time+$=value for the entire family.  It isn't a whole day activity, so add other things to do. I have no idea about the restuarant, but why not, I mean IT SPINS! People were kind about moving for photos or letting people in to look, there was a genuine happy vibe.  The weather can be an issue and can change by the time you are actually up on top, so plan accordingly.  But when it's clear you can see three mountain  ranges, beautiful.  Take binoculars and a jacket.

Go and don't forget to buy a Space Needle magnet; you just have to, it's part of the great cliche.

review.name: A Hit Since 1962
review.reviewBody: Don't get me wrong, some parts of this thing are dated, but it's still a thrill to go up in it. The views are unparalleled. It is very crowded at night, especially on weekends but it is worth it for the panorama. I enjoyed it so much that I came back the next day during the day to take pictures. If it is not cloudy (or raining) and Ranier is visible, it is an awesome sight overlooking the city. You should not miss going up while in Seattle.

review.name: Great Views of the City
review.reviewBody:
We purchased a ticket, which was a couple of hours to wait until we could go up. explored the surrounding area then sat and waited for our time.
HOT TIP: dont think you can get in the line any earlier than your ticked, it wont happen.
Once in line it still takes a while to get to the elevators, unfortunately on the day we were there one elevators had broken down.
Once we were up top it was awesome. Great 360 views.
This is a good way to kill some time.

itemListElement.name: Skip the Line: The Legends of Smith Tower Observatory Access Ticket

name: Skip the Line: The Legends of Smith Tower Observatory Access Ticket
description:
Enjoy Smith Tower like you've never seen it before. Immerse yourself in new exhibits that take you on a journey through the past one hundred years. Make your way to the top of the tower for an amazing vantage point from the Observatory, including an open-air deck with 360-degree views of Seattle and beyond. Then take a moment to indulge in Prohibition-era inspired craft cocktails and shareable plates with a group of friends or your loved ones. And don't forget to make a wish in the Wishing Chair. It's the perfect selfie to post of your visit to Smith Tower. 

Please note that tickets are valid daily between the hours of 10:00am-1:00pm. During our peak-season months of May - September, wait times may apply and can range from 30 minutes to 1.5 hours. 

Tickets to not guarantee immediate access. Black out dates may apply.

review.name: Come for the History, Stay for the Bar
review.reviewBody:
The view was amazing.  We came around 2:30 so we could see the museum, which was very interesting, and then spend some time at the bar, which was also amazing.  Obviously, there isn't any free parking anywhere nearby, and if you're easily spoked, Pioneer Square can be a bit intimidating (although it's worth noting that it's not especially dangerous, necessarily; there are just a lot of homeless folks around).

All in all, the building has a rich history, and the little speakeasy-inspired bar is phenomenal.

review.name: Walk into History!
review.reviewBody: This is Seattle's first skyscraper.  There is an interactive museum that encourages the visitor to imagine him or herself as a character living back in time of the construction of the building.  Take the elevator ride to the top and walk in the outdoor observatory and see the sights of Seattle.  The Chinese Room is unbelievable.

review.name: Great visit!  View, history and cocktails watching the sunset!
review.reviewBody: First time there and wondering why we did not go sooner! Lovely older building with a lot of history, Great views from the observatory and we loved the fact it had a bar/lounge where you could have drinks and appetizers while watching the sunset over the sound. Great that they gave reduced price for WA residents.

review.name: Fantastic views
review.reviewBody: Very beautiful views from this vantage point. You get to see the architecture and how the building used to be ran. You funny have to do the interactive part but you can enjoy the history of the site. I highly recommend if in Seattle.

review.name: Tour and lounge at the top
review.reviewBody: We were greeted by the most wonderful lady, friendly and very knowledgeable.  She walked us through the process and sent us on our way.  We took the interactive tour, it is a lot of fun. Then it was up the elevator to the 35th floor for a drink, maybe two. Our elevator guide was also outstanding. We walked into the top floor lounge and the temperature dropped.  It seemed as though the bar keep and his staff had no interest in serving us. Not a pleasant experience at the top!!!!

review.name: Go for the View, not the food
review.reviewBody:
This is a must see view and I preferred it to the Space Needle for sure.  
Have a drink up top while you wait for the sunset.  Do NOT expect great food.  The food is marginal at best and over priced for the quality.  It's a shame, because this place could really be a special place to dine if more effort was put into the food.

Definitely worth the visit for the view.

review.name: Most interesting high view
review.reviewBody:
While the Columbia Center and the Space Needle offer great views, this one should not be missed.
At 38 stories, the first skyscraper West of New York city, built 105 years ago. It is still an active office building, especially for lawyers with the court house a block away.
Admission was only $15.  The self tour starts with rooms of artifacts of 100 years ago and bios of the people involved in the original construction.
An elevator with brass cage doors takes you to the observation deck.  The view is phenomenal, including Pioneer Square which is the original city, as well as downtown, the sports stadiums and the ocean cargo ship loading cranes.
The observation floor bar was redone in 2016.  A great place for a snack and drink for business or pleasure.
Highly recommended.

review.name: Not the same after Goldman Sachs bought the building
review.reviewBody:
I used to love coming here regularly for the view and service. Ever since Goldman Sachs bought the building it has become less inviting. The prices got more expensive, the food has stayed the same, and drinks have become inconsistent. The staff remain pleasant and are apologetic for the change. 

The prices are what you'd expect from a nearby Seattle restaurant but the kitchen is so small they are limited in what they can serve. The portions are similarly quite small, though the quality of the food is high. On top of that you will pay entrance fee that is comparable to the cost of food or a drink.  

For Seattle guests this is a wonderful experience and pricing should be acceptable. The view and atmosphere is so much better than Columbia Tower or the Space Needle.

For repeat visitors it is something I do not recommend, even with membership. I find myself ordering less and less each time. When my membership expires I will likely not renewing.

review.name: Awesome Views
review.reviewBody: We've been to the Columbia building and it is super but loved that you are actually outside and not behind glass at the Smith Tower. It was fun choosing to be a character and doing the treasure hunt before heading to the observatory. Next time I would like to eat up there. A teacher discount was a sweet surprise. Also WA residents can visit at a local rate.

review.name: Interesting story then a great view
review.reviewBody: We went around the various areas reading about the history of the tower then took the ride up (with an interesting chap who talks to you en route) to the observatory. Great views, 360 degrees. We stayed for a couple of drinks as the atmosphere was good. Nice waiter who gave us recommendations for our trip to Oregon. Would highly recommend.

itemListElement.name: Upper Skagit Introductory Whitewater Rafting Trip

name: Upper Skagit Introductory Whitewater Rafting Trip
description: The Skagit brings the wonder of nature and a wild flowing river to the fingertips of our guests. This river is extraordinarily special and has a mystical feeling to it due to the rich archaeology and historical past.  This 9 mile trip through one of North Americas most gorgeous rivers awaits you! The Skagit is a mild river in comparison, but it's also very powerful; it's a great way to introduce someone to the sport, or to get started for the summer with some great whitewater that can be enjoyed by the entire family. If you or someone you love wants to get into rafting, this is the place to start.

review.name: Great Work at Flexibility!
review.reviewBody: We were scheduled for the whitewater rafting on August 4th.  With the wildfires, there was a closing of a boat ramp and our ride was adjusted to the lower river.  Triad did great at communicating, offering flexible options and being proactive in a tough situation.  I really appreciated that!  All the guides for the tour were trained well and professional.  They knew their area ecology and rafting.  Thank you!

review.name: Just a fun get away
review.reviewBody: The guides were great and were very interactive with us.  The guide in our boat told us about the landscape and what to look for and all the safety parts.  They were very friendly and fun

review.name: Would book again!
review.reviewBody:
This was such a great experience. The guides were safety oriented and very personable. They provided wet suits for the cold water. The views? Spectacular. Bring a waterproof phone case to get some pictures (on this ride there is plenty of downtime that I wish I was prepared for). This is great for a first-time rafting experience if you're nervous about rafting.
I would definitely book with them again!

review.name: Superb Summer Adventure Getaway for Our Family
review.reviewBody: Our group of six had a fantastic rafting trip on the Skagit with Triad River Tours. Our group included four 40-60 year olds, a 23 year old and an 8 year old, and this river was a great fit for us. Our guide Alastair was superb--relating well to everyone on board, getting us paddling well together, safety-minded while maintaining a playful and fun tone and giving us insights on history and naturalist aspects of the river. It was a great experience.

review.name: First time white water rafters - but not last time white water rafters due to Triad and Alastair!!
review.reviewBody: My husband, son and his girlfriend did the white water rafting with Alastair as our guide today! It was AMAZING! We didn’t know what to expect as beginners but the team and Allistair were clear, concise, patient, knowledgeable and ensured we were all safe while having A BLAST making some wonderful, lifetime  memories!! Were from Texas, stayed in Seattle and drove 2 hours to get to the Triad tours and it was SOOOO WORTH the money and drive! We will def do it the next time we visit Seattle. We loved Alastair!! He made our rafting fun and exciting! Sean also took the best photos!!!

review.name: Terrific Guides, Tame River
review.reviewBody:
Overall, we had an awesome trip with a perfect guide, Alastair. Floating the Skagit was a super fun time.

We had originally booked a trip on the Sauk river, the ‘Intermediate’ next step up compared to the ‘Introductory’ Skagit. However, the water level of the Sauk got too low to raft safely, so we had to rebook. Luke made rebooking super easy.

The Skagit is definitely a beginner level river. Probably best for families with kids, elder folks, or people nervous about their  first whitewater raft trip. Our group of active, mid-20 year olds could have easily handled quite a bit more. There were a few rapids, we got splashed a few times, but overall I do wish the float had been more thrilling. Most of the time was a relaxing float down the river. But, oh well, I look forward to floating the Sauk next year earlier in the season, and we still had a great time.

Alastair, and all the guides at Triad, were the reason we still had a great time. Alastair was fun, funny, knowledgeable, and safe. Our group chatted and laughed the whole trip and Alastair led us through the rapids perfectly. 10/10 guide. Get in his boat if you can :)

review.name: Sick RAFTING tour
review.reviewBody: This trip was a very fun birthday surprise from my very cool partner and friends. We rented a private raft and we were guided down the river by the most amazing guide Alastair. He was very knowledgeable of the river and made sure we had fun (but were safe). He made the experience an 11/10 and I would recommend anyone and everyone to check out the raft tours! All the staff were friendly, fantastic, and knowledgeable. Will be doing future white water rafting.

review.name: excellent experience - highly recommended
review.reviewBody: Amazing views and rafting experience with at most level 3 rapids in the milder tour we chose.  Fine for novices but moments of clear excitement.  The views were amazing.  A quick dip in the Skagit River in its calmer moments was bracing and enjoyable.  The tour provides wet suits.  Our guide Marshall was knowledgable, humorous, and properly prepared us in advance of our push off.

review.name: excellent!!!
review.reviewBody: this trip was amazing and so memorable!!! Allastair was our tour guide and he was incredible. all of the staff were awesome. we felt safe, supported and had so much fun! thank you Triad River Tours!

review.name: Incredible, fun and absolute blast!
review.reviewBody: This is the company you want to go white water rafting with, their safety, training and upbeat staff are top notch!   First time and was nervous I was not in physical shape to do this but it’s always been something I’ve wanted to do.  Felt safe the whole time and any fitness level can do the beginner course.  Beautiful day and between exciting and so serene all at the same time.  If you’ve been hesitating and wondering if you can do this, they are the company to join in this adventure.

address.streetAddress: 5619 Martin Luther King Jr Way S

mainEntity.name: What are some restaurants close to Ferris Wheel Waterfront Apartments By Barsala?

acceptedAnswer.text: Conveniently located restaurants include Tat's Deli, Vons 1000 Spirits, and All Water Seafood & Oyster Bar. See all nearby restaurants.

mainEntity.name: Is Ferris Wheel Waterfront Apartments By Barsala located near the city center?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, it is 0.3 miles away from the center of Seattle. See all nearby attractions.

name: BOCA Restaurant at Queen City Grill

itemListElement.name: Seattle Kraken Ice Hockey Game Ticket at Climate Pledge Arena

name: Seattle Kraken Ice Hockey Game Ticket at Climate Pledge Arena
description: Climate Pledge Arena, home of the Seattle Kraken NHL team is not only a landmark and a spiritual home to the locals of Seattle, but a must-visit for anyone eager to immerse themselves in the city's true culture, passion and history. Get the full experience of a Kraken game live at Climate Pledge Arena, by wearing the team's colours and grabbing your favourite drink (and maybe some hot wings) at a nearby sports bar while locals crowd around the big screens for some pre-game punditry, before making your way to the ice in time for the electrifying team entrances, national anthems and of course, the puck drop in the world's most-watched ice hockey competition.

brand.name: Sports Where I Am - America / P...

review.name: Exciting and Great Views
review.reviewBody: The view was great even high up. My partner and I got pretzels that were good. Each break was entertaining and they had nice people who directed us to our seats. Food and drink was expensive. There are vegan options available but I haven’t tried it yet. Playing to go again. Even though I am nota huge sports person, this game made a fan out of me!

review.name: Worth it just for Pregame Sound and Light Show
review.reviewBody: Had not been to hockey game in many years, and was astounded by size of auditorium and the lavishness of pregame sound and light show.  Parking was a brisk 10 minute walk away.  Many fans are walking with you, so feel safe enough walking from parking garage during night game. The seats can be tight for legs, but view is excellent as steeply rising grandstands.  And Kraken were exciting end of last season!

name: Running Tour of Seattle
description:
Take in the beautiful views of Seattle while on a 5k running tour in an iconic Seattle neighborhood. Your guide, Emily, will teach you all about the history of Seattle and what makes Seattle so special now. Your guided run will end at a cafe, restaurant, or brewery so that you can have a taste of Seattle, too. One drink is included with your tour price. 

5k runs are available in the following neighborhoods: West Seattle (Saturday night or Sunday morning), Pike Place (Monday mornings), Greenlake (Tuesday mornings), University of Washington (Wednesday mornings), and Fremont Friday nights). Each neighborhood is uniquely charming.

All runs are small groups, with up to seven guests. Your guide is CPR certified, knowledgeable about Seattle, and upbeat.

name: Seattle Chocolate Tour
description:
Is chocolate a food or a technology? Why does it hold such a special place in cultures around the world? Most importantly: How do YOU like your chocolate?

Included in your ticket price are 12 individual tastings. We will visit 8 of Downtown Seattle's most beloved bakeries, restaurants, cafés, and chocolatiers. 

The tour starts at Dahlia Bakery where you delight in the days fresh bake. We continue through cafés where you experience the "World Tour of drinking chocolates," along with small treats and samples of chocolate.

We spend a portion of the tour in an Italian grocer where you sample a selection of some of the best chocolate bars in the world (and from right here in Seattle). 

The tour ends at a chocolatier's shop known for its elite quality and unique incorporation of flavors, including fruit, honey and booze.

You'll leave this tour filled to the brim with chocolatey goodness, but also with a deeper understanding of what chocolate is, what it means, and where it's taking us.

review.name: Great experience!
review.reviewBody: What a great and delicious time. It was fun to learn a little about Seattle history while enjoying so many delicious chocolate treats. The guide was a sweetheart, it was a very fun morning.

review.name: Cancelled
review.reviewBody: On the day scheduled, they asked us to move the time an hour later. Since we had other plans this would not work. Therefore, they cancelled on us. However, they did give us a refund.

review.name: Great tour
review.reviewBody: My husband and I always try to do a chocolate tour when we visit a new city. This was our first one with an actual guide and she didn’t disappoint. She was very knowledgeable for both chocolate and Seattles history.

review.name: Highly recommend!
review.reviewBody: Laura was an amazing tour guide. So passionate and kind. We had a small group but she didn’t let that get to us but actually made it special giving us a closer look at things a big group wouldn’t have been able to do. We even ran into Will the owner running another tour and he knew our names and was so welcoming. Would absolutely do another tour again.

review.name: Walking Chocolate Tour with Will
review.reviewBody: Went on the walking chocolate tour with Will and it was really great! Got to try things I would have never known where available - ranging from truffles to a brownie to drinking chocolate. My son (11) had a great time as well and Will was great with him. Would highly recommend and I would definitely do another tour if we come back!

review.name: Great treats and lots of other great recommendations along the way
review.reviewBody: The chocolate tour was great! Will was super knowledgeable without being pretentious, and there was a lot of good casual conversation at and between and at stops. He also had lots of great recommendations along the tour for other activities and places to check out.

review.name: Disappointing tour
review.reviewBody:
We tasted some very good samples of sweet treats but nothing was discussed about the Seattle chocolate scene, process of making chocolate, or the importance of chocolate as it relates to Seattle (which are all listed as highlights of the tour). If you are wanting to just walk around and sample things, you will like this tour. If you want to learn about Seattle chocolate then I would not recommend (especially for the cost). We were very disappointed. 
I contacted the company before writing a review to share our experience. However, never received a response back.

review.name: Awesome
review.reviewBody: So delicious! My tour guide, Ivy, was super helpful and had a lot of chocolate knowledge. Would highly recommend for any chocolate lover!

review.name: Super fun Chocolate Tour!
review.reviewBody: We had a blast on this tour! We walked the perfect amount, and our guide, Ivy, was charming and knowledgeable. She took us to great places and was super organized.

review.name: Seattle does chocolate!
review.reviewBody: Ivy was a very knowledgeable host and took us to some fabulous places! Learned a lot about Seattle and chocolate! My 12 YO loved it; highly recommend

itemListElement.name: Leavenworth Reindeer Farm + Village Lights Festival

name: Leavenworth Reindeer Farm + Village Lights Festival
description: Experience something NEW this Holiday Season with Customized Tours.  Spend the day with us as we transport you from Downtown Seattle to the Bavarian village of Leavenworth in the Cascade Mountains. Come visit with actual reindeer at the Leavenworth Reindeer Farm where guests young and old marvel at the hands-on personal reindeer encounter with interactive educational presentation. Drink hot cocoa or cider around a crackling campfire. Get your picture taken with jolly Old Saint Nick (Special Guest appearance on Jan 16th).  Then spend the remainder of the day in the Leavenworth Village of Lights where every night is illuminated with bright twinkling lights decorating the town.  Browse quaint old-world shops, savor authentic German food from street stands and local eateries, and enjoy live outdoor entertainment.  On the way home, relax on your comfortable trip back to Seattle ready to share holiday spirit and treasured memories with others.  Don’t forget your camera!

review.name: Great Experience
review.reviewBody: It had been a long time since my kids and I ventured out to Leavenworth.  I was a little worried that the trip would not be as fun since they town no longer offers the lighting ceremony and the sleigh rides was not offered but boy was I wrong!   Customized Tours provided great service getting us to/from Leavenworth.  They had light snacks for us to enjoy during the ride. When we arrived we got to go to their new partnered attraction at the Reindeer Farm; feed the reindeers, take pictures with the special guests appearance that took place that day (Frozen characters).  We then ventured into the town of Leavenworth where there was TONS of snow.  We sled (provided by Customized Tours), walked around the town, shopped and enjoyed tasty food at Andrea Kellers.   My children had so much fun and slept all the way back.   I would highly recommend this excursion not only for their great service but because it took all the stress off of my family having to drive in the snow, find parking and pay for parking etc.

review.name: Loved our Reindeer Farm experiance
review.reviewBody: Truly a one of a kind experience.  We got up close and and feed reindeer.  This is vary family friendly and they do not rush you out just to get next group in.  They offer free photos with the reindeer and the whole thing was capped off by free cider/cocoa.   We loved it.

name: Leavenworth Village of Lights Festival
description: Spend the day in Leavenworth this Holiday Season with us. Let us provide the transportation for you from Downtown Seattle to the Bavarian village of Leavenworth in the Cascade Mountains. Spend the day browsing and shopping the village’s quaint old-world themed shops, savor authentic German food from street stands and local eateries, enjoy live outdoor entertainment, and should you choose; splurge on a horse-drawn winter carriage ride. The Village Lights show off the town's promenade and marvel 24 hours a day as the trees burst ablaze with hundreds of thousands of twinkling lights. Afterward, relax on your comfortable trip home filled with the holiday spirit, and treasured lifetime memories.

itemListElement.name: Private Yacht Cruises Around Puget Sound

name: Private Yacht Cruises Around Puget Sound
description:
Salty Fox is a large, comfortable yacht with two cabins, a spacious salon, and friendly personnel.
The yacht is under the control of a professional captain and is equipped with all the necessary life-saving appliances.
We know how to make the boating experience pleasant and unforgettable. We guarantee exceptional service, an individual approach, and pleasant emotions from a cruise.
Based on the customer needs we can plan a trip with a stop to explore the beautiful islands of Puget Sound. You will have time to enjoy breathtaking views from the water, take photos from unusual views, and also time to walk on land and experience small towns atmosphere. 
For trips with no stop, we will go through a few hidden gems around Puget Sound - locations with amazing views, that are inaccessible from the land.

review.name: Impoliteness on the bay
review.reviewBody: We used this service for a wedding anniversary. Seattle has great scenery and the boat was in decent condition, but the service was not ideal. I found the captain, although strict to her duties, rude. Unpolite and short-tempered, if I had to sum it up. I was hoping for a bit more professionalism when people pay this much for a cruise. Perhaps she was just having a bad day? This did, unfortunately, ruin our experience and I had to salvage our anniversary later via a tour of the Space Needle. I would not recommend Salty Fox for yacht rental if you plan on capturing timeless memories.

review.name: Immaculate boat!  No surprises!
review.reviewBody: Olga was great in planning our excursion.  Very responsive and flexible.  The accommodations were exactly as advertised!  No surprises.  As captain of the ship, Olga was focused on safety and gave us great confidence in her abilities.  The boat is in immaculate condition!

address.streetAddress: 621 1/2 Queen Anne Ave N Russo Building
1501 Pike Pl Ste 501 Mezzanine Level 5th Floor

itemListElement.name: Plant Based in Pike Place Food Tour (GF available)

name: Plant Based in Pike Place Food Tour (GF available)
description:
You surely don’t have to have dietary restrictions to enjoy this tour. We delight in accommodating everyone. 

On this tour you will visit 10 restaurants and shops within the Market historical district and delight in custom tastings from these locations. We choose restaurants to showcase the best-of-the-best in Seattle and to highlight hidden gems you might not find on your own.

Along the way you will learn about the iconic Pike Place Market. We will introduce you to some of the people that give the Market its authentic feel, along with those rethinking our relationship with food for a brighter, healthier future.

You will learn about the city of Seattle and its home in the Pacific Northwest. We will discuss Washington State as an understated agricultural juggernaut and how that feeds into Seattle’s reputation as a world capital for artisanal food and drink. 

Our philosophy is that each person’s diet should not close doors, but open them. This tour is for you. Come and join us!

review.name: Fabulous experience!
review.reviewBody: Will showed us so many delightful places that fit our dietary needs! Remember to go starving because there is sooooo much to eat!

review.name: Explore Pike Place Market Through A Plant Based Lens
review.reviewBody: What a great tour! Ivy was a fabulous guide and provided lots of cool history about the area and about Pike Place Market. We had several stops and were offered a variety of foods. A few shops provided the opportunity to purchase items, but there was no pressure. We were STUFFED after our fun 2 hours. Highly recommend!

review.name: Awesome food tour!
review.reviewBody:
First of all, we LOVED our guide Ivy, she was considerate, charismatic, and kind. If there is any way you can get her as a guide specifically, do so!!! 

We visited multiple spots all throughout Pike Market on our vegan food tour. Every spot was amazing, and the relationships the shop workers had with the tour company was lovely to see. We were provided with interesting information about the market and each stop along the way in a pleasant, easily digestible way, not overwhelming at all! The food was marvelous, and it was in perfectly sized portions.

I can’t recommend the company or the vegan food tour enough!

review.name: Awesome Experience!
review.reviewBody: Ivy was a great tour guide. She showed us many delicious vegan treats of all different varieties. I would highly recommend this tour.

review.name: Great way to learn about Pike and a bunch of different food
review.reviewBody: Ivy was a great host and taught us a lot about the area, about which she is clearly passionate. Found a few spots for sure I’ll be coming back to and was a really way to get to see pike and find good vegan places to eat. Highly suggest for a vegan coming for a trip to Seattle.

review.name: Tasty and Fun
review.reviewBody: This is a great way to familiarize yourself with the market. All the food was delicious and Will is a super nice dude. And you get some of everything, drinks, desserts, fruits as well as savory foods.

review.name: Personalized behind the scenes look at the plant-based food scene in Pike Place market from a fun, well informed local
review.reviewBody: Will had a broad knowledge of the restaurants and businesses in Pike Place, interspersed with historical stories of Seattle.  We highly recommend this tour with Will as the guide. He listened to our specific requests and tailored his tour to match our interests.

review.name: Great experience,  highly recommend.
review.reviewBody: This was a great experience.   I've lived around Seattle for years and saw parts of the market I'd never seen.   The food was fantastic.  Great guide, Ivy was engaging, fun, and knowledgeable.  Would definitely recommend.  A+

review.name: Vegan food tour with Jade
review.reviewBody: Jade was fantastic in leading a vegan food tour. Not only is she incredibly knowledgeable about Pike Place and its history, she went to culinary school so she really knows her stuff. Highly recommend taking this tour with her, you are sure to have a good time (and eat some delicious food along the way)

review.name: Great way to learn about AMAZING places to eat in Pike Place
review.reviewBody: I stumbled upon this through Fever and couldn't contain my excitement. Our tour guide, Will, was energetic, and friendly, and knew so much about the market and the places we visited. The tour is well-paced/sized too. You definitely get nibbles of so many great plant-based goods sweet and savory, but it's not so much that you feel like you over-ate. If you're in Seattle for a while, I highly recommend doing this early in your trip. That way, you have TONS of great foods to go back to Pike Place for again later in your trip!

address.streetAddress: 6850 E Green Lake Way N Ste 101
1901 Western Ave Suite E Suite E
